It is characterized by its tall, dense growth habit and its ability to form extensive carpets in moist, shaded environments. The plant has elongated, leafy shoots that are often curved and have a distinctive, glossy appearance. Its sporophytes are typically short and produce spores in capsules that are covered by a peristome. Taeniophyllum maximum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded forest floors.
